attributes.action: Make 2020 GCSE grades have no effect on university admissions for all students
attributes.additional_details: The overall system that is being used to calculate GCSE grades for all candidates is deeply unfair and may negatively affect all students, and specifically those from a lower-class background. It is very well known that various teacher-predicted grades will be dropped due to ‘generosity’, thus potentially causing thousands of students-particularly those that come from lower-income backgrounds and those that go to lower-performing schools (including me) will be penalised for very little reason.
attributes.background: Since 2020 GCSE grades will be incredibly inconsistent and may have a high proportion of grades lowered, i believe the government should advise universities/employers to not weigh 2020 GCSE grades at all when considering applications, as ‘our’ results will not be indicative of our abilities.

rejection.details:
Decisions about university admissions are a matter for individual universities, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

We have published the following related petition, which you might like to sign:

Review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773
